privileged_goal: Eggs scrambled or made into an omelette
Eggs with vegetables like bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms
Prefer side of fruits or avocado with eggs
Toast toasted with spreads like avocado or hummus; instead of nut-based spreads
Prefer herbal teas like peppermint or chamomile
Beverages such as tea or coffee should be black, without milk or sugar
Avoid nuts and nut based spreads on toast
When adding milk to cereal, avoid nut-based milk, use a dairy-based alternative instead
When using yoghurt, avoid nut-based yoghurt
Add fruits as a topping to sweet breakfasts, such as oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, pancakes, french toast, cereal
Serve items in a certain order, starting with the food first, then beverages
Eat breakfast at a standing desk or kitchen island

rollout.progress_summary: You have not made anything yet.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.user_feedback: I'd love to add some fresh fruit to my yoghurt parfait. Usually, I'm open to both fresh and dried fruits, but for a parfait, I think fresh fruit would be a great choice. Berries would be a great option, or sliced banana would be nice too.

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter

- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. - Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

rollout.user_feedback: I think I'd like the dining room to be at a comfortable temperature, not too hot or too cold. I'm not particular about the temperature, so whatever is normal for the house would be fine.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

You have no prior information about Samantha.

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

You have no prior information about Samantha.

- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter

- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. <|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Samantha wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

"what type of milk would you like to use to add some extra creaminess to your yoghurt parfait? we have oat milk, almond milk, or a non-dairy creamer as options"
"would you like your granola to be toasted or not? this will add a nice crunch to your parfait"

"how would you like your whole grain bread to be prepared? would you like it lightly toasted or more caramelized, and would you like any spread on it, such as peanut butter spread or mixed fruit jam?"
"what is your preferred method for preparing the fresh fruit you chose earlier? would you like it to be sliced, diced, or left as is?"
"what is your preferred type of sweetener to add to your yoghurt parfait? we have honey, maple syrup, or stevia as options"
"would you like some crispy bacon or cooked sausage on the side with your yoghurt parfait, or would you like to keep your breakfast light and just have the parfait?"

"what is your preferred method for preparing the whole grain bread slice that we will be using as the base for your parfait? would you like it to be lightly toasted or more caramelized, and would you like any butter on it?"

"do you have a preferred order for assembling your yoghurt parfait, or would you like me to suggest a classic combination of layers? for example, do you want the yoghurt as the base, the toasted bread on the bottom, or the fruit on top?"
"would you like a cup of coffee or tea to go with your yoghurt parfait? we have a variety of coffee options such as brewed, espresso, or iced coffee, and tea options such as hot or iced tea"
"what type of milk would you like me to use to make the hot black tea? we have oat milk, almond milk, or a non-dairy creamer as options"

"what is your preferred method for preparing the sliced fresh fruit that we will be using on top of the yoghurt parfait? would you like it to be lightly sweetened or not, and would you like any other toppings such as chopped nuts or seeds?"

"what is your preferred method for cooking the bacon_0 (a pack of breakfast bacon, contains bacon_strip) that you mentioned earlier you were open to having on the side? would you like it to be pan-fried, oven-roasted, or microwaved?"
"shall i serve the yoghurt parfait and hot black tea now that they are ready, or would you like to sit down and enjoy them in a particular setting, such as in the dining room or on the patio?"
"what is your preferred temperature in the dining room for you to enjoy your yoghurt parfait and hot black tea? would you like the room to be warm and cozy, or cool and refreshing?"
"shall i add some crunch to your hot black tea by adding a slice of lemon or not?"
"would you like your hot black tea to be served in a mug that is hot or insulated? this will help keep your tea at the right temperature for you to enjoy

"what is your preferred method for preparing the hot black tea? would you like it to be made with boiling water, or would you like me to use a temperature control to heat the water to a specific temperature?"
"shall i call this breakfast 'yoghurt parfait' or would you like to give it a different name?"

"what is your preferred method for toasting the bread_1 (a loaf of sprouted whole grain bread, contains whole_grain_bread_slice)? would you like it to be toasted on the island_0 (kitchen island next to countertop with two seats) using the toaster_0 (a classic 2-bread toaster, open), or would you like it to be grilled using a pan_0 (a non-stick frying pan) on the stovetop?"
